channel.title: How can I freeze someone's client?
channel.description: How can I freeze someone's client? I am blocking other clients besides my own but some people are so retarded the feel if they click login enough that will change, so I am making them log in, then a menu pops up saying to get the client, then it freezes them right then and there.

item.title: How can I freeze someone's client?
item.dc:creator: @tj007razor tj007razor
item.description:
@tj007razor wrote:

akl I despise smart-ass comments with a passion.

Spotlight I don’t want it to disconnect I want it to freeze.
qwertyuiop I want them able to play after they get my client, that’d screw their account over
openice that keeps the client instance running on the server, which is unneeded.

Anyway I figured how to do it. If they aren’t using my client I just open the menu, then have it display a local gfx (in this case gfx 9) that freezes their client, then disconnect them. Works fine. Seriously was not that hard, I just didn’t think of it at first, and certainly did not require Akl being a smart-ass.

Read full topic
item.source: How can I freeze someone's client?

item.title: How can I freeze someone's client?
item.dc:creator: @Spotlight Spotlight
item.description:
@Spotlight wrote:

Get it to send a null responce or something. If you have a way of telling which client they are using, add the is disconnected = true command and it will disconnect them. You should make it send a message first telling them why. But idk just my 2 cents.

Read full topic

item.title: How can I freeze someone's client?
item.dc:creator: @tj007razor tj007razor
item.description:
@tj007razor wrote:

Hey cockbag, I simply need to cause the client to freeze by telling it to display/do something out of its ability and it freezes. I have seen it before on other posts but I can’t seem to find it again so I’m just asking if people know how, no need to PMS on me.

Read full topic
